title: Bob Segar - Whisky A Go-Go L.A, 1975 ak320
description:
Bob Segar - Whisky A Go-Go L.A, 1975 ak320

In my searching I have come across a few of these Bob Seger and SBB shows and I wondered how I would share em. Duh Ill post em. That was a easy solve huh?
 But Maybe I can do something else as well.
So I made it into a series of shows and I will share em until 1983,you stop clicking or I run out.

Whichever comes first. Now some history...

Robert Clark Seger May 6, 1945 is an American singer-songwriter, guitarist and pianist. 
As a Detroit-area artist, he performed as Bob Seger and the Last Heard and Bob Seger System throughout the 1960s. By the 1970s, he had dropped the 'System' and strove for success with  other bands. In 1973, he put together the Silver Bullet Band, with a group of Detroit-area musicians, whom he became very successful with. They recorded Live Bullet in 1975 at Cobo Hall in Detroit. It was on and cracken.   Seger had a popularity imbalance. In June 1976, he Headlined at the Pontiac Silverdome in front of  80,000 fans. 
The next night, He played before less than a thousand people in Chicago.

Tracklist 

01 - Steal Your Love Away.mp3
02 - Back in '72.mp3
03 - Bo Diddley.mp3
04 - Travelin' Man.mp3
05 - Beautiful Loser.mp3
06 - Bring It Back from Mexico.mp3 
07 - Ramblin' Gamblin' Man.mp3
08 - Katmandu.mp3
09 - Feel Like Wakin' Up in Somebody Elses Bed (Bonus).mp3
10 - Let It Rock.mp3
11 - Rosaly.mp3
12 - Boogie(inc. Whole Lotta Love).mp3
13 - Lucifer.mp3

The Silver Bullet Band 1975 (Subject to change)

    Bob Seger – lead vocals, guitar, piano
    Drew Abbott – lead guitar, background vocals
    Alto Reed - tenor saxophone, alto saxophone, baritone saxophone, percussion, background vocals
    Robyn Robins – organ, clavinet, mellotron, piano 
    Chris Campbell – bass guitar, background vocals
    Charlie Allen Martin – drums, background vocals
